---
title: "token_zero_grace_period.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines authentication settings for a system, specifically focusing on token-based authentication. It enables token authentication and sets a zero grace period for token cleanup.

## Symbols

### `authentication`
#### Description
The root configuration block for authentication settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets authentication as required for the system.
- Defines token as an authentication method.

### `authentication.required`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether authentication is mandatory for the system.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| required | boolean | Determines if authentication is required |

### `authentication.methods`
#### Description
Defines the available authentication methods for the system.

### `authentication.methods.token`
#### Description
Configuration block for token-based authentication.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables token authentication.
- Configures cleanup settings for tokens.

### `authentication.methods.token.enabled`
#### Description
A boolean flag to enable or disable token-based authentication.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Determines if token authentication is enabled |

### `authentication.methods.token.cleanup`
#### Description
Configuration block for token cleanup settings.

### `authentication.methods.token.cleanup.grace_period`
#### Description
Specifies the grace period for token cleanup.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| grace_period | integer | The grace period for token cleanup, set to 0 |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| authentication.required | boolean | true | Determines if authentication is required |
| authentication.methods.token.enabled | boolean | true | Enables token-based authentication |
| authentication.methods.token.cleanup.grace_period | integer | 0 | Sets the grace period for token cleanup to 0 |

This configuration file sets up a system where authentication is required, token-based authentication is enabled, and there is no grace period for token cleanup (immediate cleanup). The zero grace period suggests that tokens will be immediately invalidated or removed when they expire or are no longer needed, without any additional time allowance.
